poem:
Title: Courtroom Ballet

In supreme sittings, the gavel strikes - 
A tenebrous drama cloaked in law's attire.
In the dancer's leap from right to high claim,
Do we discern truth or mewling desire?
Even justice peers into history's eclipse; 
Its scales waiver in the immunity's eclipse.
Are these acts official? A president's sanctum?
Or the final throes of unchecked ambition?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US supreme court eyes returning Trump immunity claim to lower court after arguments The US supreme court on Thursday expressed interest in returning Donald Trump’s criminal case over his efforts to overturn the 2020 election back to a lower court to decide whether certain parts of the indictment were “official acts” that were protected by presidential immunity. During oral arguments, the justices appeared unlikely to grant Trump’s request for absolute immunity from criminal prosecution, with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
